name: 亻
meaning_mnemonic: This is how kanji for human evoluated from this radical: 人 → 亻

name: 彳
meaning_mnemonic: You can hust imagine two steps above one vertical line.

name: 日
meaning_mnemonic: Since there are no circles in Japanese characters, sometimes rectangles or squares have to make do. In this case, this big rectangle is the sun. The middle line going through the center horizontally is the equator line. Imagine the sun as a big rectangle in the sky with a line through it and think about how weird that is - if you think it's weird enough in your mind, you'll probably remember this radical as well!

name: 人
meaning_mnemonic: If you look closely this shape resembles human shape.

name: 月
meaning_mnemonic: The moon is actually made of the sun, but it has streamers coming off of it leaning towards the left. Why? because the moon is always running away from the sun as fast as it can. It wouldn't want to get caught by the fire of the sun, after all!

name: 寺
meaning_mnemonic: You can imagine a temple building which resembles this shape.

name: 亅
meaning_mnemonic: This radical is shaped like a barb, like you'd see on barb wire, or something. Imagine one of these getting stuck in your arm, and think about how much it would hurt to pull it out with that hook on the end.

name: 大
meaning_mnemonic: This radical looks just like a stick figure - more specifically, a really big dude stick figure. When you see this radical, just think big because this guy is really BIG!

name: 女
meaning_mnemonic: This radical looks like two stacked X's, one on top of the other. When it comes to chromosomes, we usually think of males as XY and females as XX. Just think of those XX's as a symbol for a woman.

name: 宀
meaning_mnemonic: The helmet is almost like the lid (亠) except it has the little side things to hold it onto something. That's why this is a helmet that goes onto things you need to protect.

name: 亠
meaning_mnemonic: This looks just like something you'd put on a kettle, right? Even a little handle to make sure you don't burn yourself. This radical is some kind of lid.

name: 一
meaning_mnemonic: This radical consists of a single, horizontal stroke. What's the biggest, single, horizontal stroke? That's the ground. Look at the ground, look at this radical, now look at the ground again. Kind of the same, right?

name: 二
meaning_mnemonic: You have TWO lines, it's simple!

name: 口
meaning_mnemonic: A big gaping square hole represents someone opening their giant mouth to tell you something stupid.

name: 儿
meaning_mnemonic: This radical already looks like a pair of legs. There's even feet on these legs

name: 五
meaning_mnemonic: If you use your imagination, this radical actually looks like the number "5".

name: ト
meaning_mnemonic: This radical looks just like the katakana ト (to) character, which sounds like the word toe. So, when you see ト think toe.

name: 子
meaning_mnemonic: This radical is made up of two barbs and one ground radical. If there are barbs on the ground, whom (especially) do you want to avoid that area? You want the child to avoid it, since children are so careless and often don't wear shoes. Imagine how bad you'd feel if you let a child walk around on top of these barbs! Pretty bad, I imagine.

name: 生
meaning_mnemonic: This radical consists of a cow radical with the ground radical below it. If you have cows on solid ground, then you really do have a good life, I think. Sometimes this radical will show up without the slide part on the side too, though we'll treat them both as "life."

name: 又
meaning_mnemonic: This looks just like a fold-out stool, amiright?

name: ナ
meaning_mnemonic: This radical looks like the katakana character "na" (ナ) which we're going to say stands for narwhal.

name: 幸
meaning_mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji happiness. Don't get confused with the radical "spicy" which is very similar.
You have a drop of water at the top, and then a squiggly looking thing that looks like it could be a slide. That's why this radical is the water slide. What fun!

name: 气
meaning_mnemonic: This radical is shaped kind of like a dam. See the wall and the water pushing over the top? If this radical is a dam, then it must create a ton of energy as well!

name: メ
meaning_mnemonic: This radical is treasure because "X marks the spot" as they say. Don't confuse this radical with Narwhal (ナ). This one looks more like an X, which is where the treasure is.

name: 元
meaning_mnemonic: You have "two" and "legs" making up this radical. Between two legs is where you came from, no matter how you look at it. These two legs are your origin.

name: 禾
meaning_mnemonic: This radical is a tree with something extra on the top. Although it's sort of arbitrary, we're going to associate this kind of tree with a pine tree, making this radical a pine.

name: ム
meaning_mnemonic: This little triangle isn't quite a triangle because it's not one single thing. It's several things put together to form a little pile of something.

name: 隹
meaning_mnemonic: This looks kind of like the top of the bird radical, but not quite. It's kind of a dumb looking bird radical top. What's a dumb bird, so dumb that it would look into the sky to drown itself with its mouth open? A turkey.

name: 言
meaning_mnemonic: One. One. One. One. Mouth. The mouth will say one thing at a time. It's doing what mouths do best, just saying things one after another. That's why this radical is "say."

name: 弋
meaning_mnemonic: This radical looks like a guy standing on one foot (because you only see one leg) holding onto something that produces drops of liquid. This person is pretty drunk, apparently. It's because he's performing the ceremony of drinking lots and lots.

name: 工
meaning_mnemonic: You know those big steel girders that are used for the frame of big buildings? This is like the end of one of those - they have a very distinct shape, just like this radical. These girders are used in construction, which is why this radical means construction. Funny thing is, you use these girders to put together buildings just like you're going to use this radical to put together kanji!

name: 馬
meaning_mnemonic: Don't confuse this radical with bird. It looks similar with the wing on the bottom and the shape on top, but it doesn't have a feather sticking out of the top of its head. So while it moves fast like it has wings, it's no bird, it's a horse.
